title: Daily Routine Verbs (Wake up, Eat, Work).
reading_greek: Κάθε μέρα, ξυπνάω νωρίς. Μετά, τρώω πρωινό. Στη συνέχεια, πηγαίνω στη δουλειά. Εργάζομαι πολλές ώρες.
reading_english: Every day, I wake up early. Then, I eat breakfast. After that, I go to work. I work many hours.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 9. Today we are going to learn some common daily routine verbs in Greek. We will focus on 'wake up', 'eat', and 'work'. Listen carefully to this short passage: [Reading Greek]. Κάθε μέρα, ξυπνάω νωρίς. Μετά, τρώω πρωινό. Στη συνέχεια, πηγαίνω στη δουλειά. Εργάζομαι πολλές ώρες. Now, let's break it down. 'Ξυπνάω' means 'I wake up'. 'Τρώω' means 'I eat'. And 'εργάζομαι' means 'I work'. You can also say 'δουλειά' for 'work' or 'job'. For example, 'πηγαίνω στη δουλειά' means 'I go to work'. Practice saying these verbs. Remember, consistency is key in learning. Keep practicing your daily routine in Greek!
